questions.questionText: What percentage of the earth is covered by water?
questions.solutionText: Water is the most abundant molecule on the Earth's surface, covering about 71% of the surface of the planet.
questions.hintText: If you multiply it to 7 the answer is 497.

questions.questionText: How many of Earth's oxygen is produced by the Amazon rainforest.
questions.solutionText: Amazon rainforests contribute 20% of the total oxygen in the earth's atmosphere.

questions.questionText: This essential gas is important so that we can breathe.
questions.solutionText: Oxygen is the most important for keeping us alive because body cells need it for energy and growth.
questions.hintText: A colorless, odorless reactive gas, the life-supporting component of the air.

questions.questionText: It is the largest planet in our solar system at nearly 11 times the size of Earth and 317 times its mass.
questions.solutionText: The largest planet in our solar system by far is Jupiter.
questions.hintText: The color of this planet is yellow or yellowish-orange.

questions.questionText: What is the nearest planet to the sun?
questions.solutionText: Even though Mercury is closest to the Sun, the average temperature on it's surface is much less than that of Venus.
questions.hintText: The planet probably received this name because it moves so quickly across the space.

questions.questionText: What is the rarest blood type?
questions.solutionText: AB negative is the rarest of the eight main blood types - just 1% of our donors have it.
questions.hintText: In total only 3% of donors belong to this blood type group.

questions.questionText: What is the largest known animal?
questions.solutionText: Reaching a maximum confirmed length of 29.9 meters and weight of 173 tonnes, it is the largest animal
questions.hintText: It weighs up to 400,000 pounds (approximately 33 elephants) and reaching up to 98 feet in length.

questions.questionText: What is the boiling point of water?
questions.solutionText: At sea level, water boils at 100 degree celsius. At higher altitudes the temperature of the boiling point is lower.
questions.hintText: It is more than 50 degrees Celcius.

questions.questionText: Animals that eat both plants and meat are called what?
questions.solutionText: Omnivores are animals that eat both plant- and animal-derived food.
questions.hintText: The size of an animal does not determine what it eats.

questions.questionText: What part of the plant conducts photosyntehsis?
questions.solutionText: Chloroplasts absorbs certain portions of the visible spectrum and captures energy from sunlight.
questions.hintText: Photosynthesis takes place in chloroplasts, which contain the chlorophyll.
